newsitem.title: USA: Gemstar shares up on hopes for TV guide.
newsitem.headline: Gemstar shares up on hopes for TV guide.

text.p: Shares of Gemstar International rose on Monday as the approval of its merger with StarSight Telecast Inc convinced investors the company was poised to be the lead provider of on-screen television guides, an analyst said.

Last week, Gemstar and StarSight Telecast Inc said the companies' shareholders approved their merger. StarSight develops and markets the StarSight interactive program guide, an on-screen TV program guide which enabled viewers to find, select and record television programs.
Gemstar develops, markets and licenses proprietary technologies and systems aimed at making technology user- friendly for consumers.

"Gemstar has become the lead holder of intellectual property in the area of on-screen television guides, as personal computers and television converge," Joseph Arsenio II, an equity analyst at Hambrecht & Quist said.
Gemstar shares closed up three points at 18-3/8.
Arsenio also said restrictions on analysts who had worked on the StarSight merger were lifted recently and that at the end of last week, he said favorable comments on the firm.
Earnings visibility on Gemstar would improve later in the week as the company provided more details on its combined business model from the StarSight merger.
